definition: loose/to loosen/to relax/floss (dry, fluffy food product made from shredded, seasoned meat or fish, used as a topping or filling)
to collapse/to break or wear down/to defeat

sentences.english: Well, partly, no doubt the terms are often used loosely.
sentences.chinese: 無疑，部分是因爲這些用語經常用得鬆鬆垮垮。

sentences.english: Select the right clothes, do not wear baggy clothes.
sentences.chinese: 不要穿過於鬆垮肥大的衣服，穿着一定要合身。

sentences.english: Saggy 7 mattress causes discomfort 8 and reduces our sleep quality.
sentences.chinese: 鬆垮的牀墊會讓你感到不舒服，降低我們的睡眠質量。

sentences.english: Hopkins looked thinner than before a bent figure with a gray double-breasted suit flapping loosely on him.
sentences.chinese: 灰色的雙排口西裝在他身上顯得鬆鬆垮垮的。

sentences.english: Do not wear jeans that are too tight or too baggy.
sentences.chinese: 千萬別穿太緊身或者太鬆垮的仔褲。

sentences.english: It's the fashion. All the skateboarders wear baggy pants.
sentences.chinese: 你不覺得那些褲子太鬆垮了嗎？

sentences.english: I do not intend to have my professional reputation compromised by the slackness of a few temporary officers.
sentences.chinese: 我不想讓幾個臨時軍官的鬆鬆垮垮破壞了我的榮譽。

sentences.english: Don't get slack at your work.
The firm had been run rather slackly .
sentences.chinese: 那家公司一直經營得鬆鬆垮垮。

sentences.english: To protect the rope from sharp edges or loose rock.
sentences.chinese: 爲了保護繩子避開尖銳的巖角或鬆垮的石塊。

sentences.english: She didn't wear makeup, dressed in baggy, androgynous clothing, sang Western songs.
sentences.chinese: 化妝，穿鬆垮垮又雌雄同體的衣服，唱了西方歌。

sentences.english: If you wear a micro-mini skirt pair it with a big sweater.
sentences.chinese: 而穿小迷你裙的時候就可以用鬆垮的毛衣來搭配。

sentences.english: In loose cases, always make sure to keep the blade and scabbard separately when storing.
sentences.chinese: 刀鞘鬆垮的時候，一定要注意刀和刀鞘分開儲放。

sentences.english: I go to school dressed in baggy clothes everyday.
sentences.chinese: 我每天穿鬆鬆垮垮的衣服上學。

definition: loose (soil, or limbs of a relaxed person etc)/flaky (pastry etc)
